item.dc:creator: niallkennedy
item.description: The Atom feed currently outputs a type attribute value of bloginfo('html_type') for an entry's summary when the element value (the_excerpt_rss()) appears to always be plain text by default.

item.title: Ticket #1259 (Post Password Not Working) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have this exact same problem, very frustrating. I'm on WP 1.5 on IIS and use different browsers on different machines. Only one seems work at a time, the others result in the blank login screen not invalid password, it just returns to the login screen after using the correct password.

I can then request that a new password is sent. If I then enter my new password on say IE on machine 1 it will work, but Firefox on that same machine will then not work neither will IE or Firefox on machine 2. I can repeat with a differnt setup. thx!

edited on: 05-06-05 14:20

item.title: Ticket #1313 ([patch] be consistent with double quotes usage in generated HTML) updated
item.dc:creator: Leffe

item.title: Ticket #1313 ([patch] be consistent with double quotes usage in generated HTML) created
item.dc:creator: Leffe
item.description: Currently a few functions use single quotes for HTML attributes. Mixing double and single quotes does not look very good in my opinion. This patch replaces all instances I have found/experienced with double quotes.
